cab.content: A .O FtIIP (0S E 0 R E.TBATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 8th August, 1910,WESTERN FRONT.At dawn this morning the British IVth Army andFrench 1st Army under the command of Field Marshal Sir Douglas Haig attacked on a wide front east and south east of AMIE3BS. It is reported that the attack is making satiefac-" tory progress, and the line MOREUIL - DEMUIN - MARCELCAVB -WARPDISEE-ABANCOURT - high ground west of SERIZY - high ground south of MORLANCOURT has already been reached. British.. Canadian and Australian troops are taking part in the attack and tanks are also co-operating.On the French front there is nothing of specialinterest to report.ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.There is nothing to report.General Staff,War Office, S.W.,1. 8th August, 1918. Issued at 12.26 p*nu
